New Records: Colt Keith finished 2-for-4 with two RBIs
Key Match Events: The Tigers took care of business in the eighth inning, scoring two runs against left-handed reliever Garrett Cleavinger for a 4-3 lead.
The Tigers stormed back in the sixth inning, facing right-handed reliever Hunter Bigge. Three consecutive batters reached safely, all with two outs:

Casey Mize impressed in the sixth, when he allowed a leadoff double but stranded the runner with three strikeouts in a row: Dylan Carlson (splitter, swinging), Josh Lowe (fastball, swinging) and Jose Siri (fastball, called)
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers (85-74) have a 30-11 record in their past 41 games.
Reese Olson made his third start since returning from the injured list, increasing his pitch count to 72 pitches.
Casey Mize worked as a reliever for the first time in his professional career.
Others: Tyler Alexander, a crafty southpaw who pitched for the Tigers from 2019-23, shove five scoreless innings with six strikeouts, limiting the Tigers to just four hits.
